summary:
The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on Yemen, adopted Resolution 2452 (2019) on January 16, 2019. The resolution establishes a Special Political Mission, the United Nations Mission to support the Hodeidah Agreement (UNMHA), for an initial period of six months to support the implementation of the Hodeidah Agreement. 

UNMHA's mandate includes: leading and supporting the Redeployment Coordination Committee (RCC); monitoring the ceasefire and redeployment of forces; working with parties to ensure the security of Hodeidah city and ports; and facilitating United Nations support.

The Secretary-General's proposals on UNMHA's composition and operational aspects are approved. The Mission will be headed by the Chair of the RCC at Assistant-Secretary-General level.

The Security Council underlines the importance of close collaboration among United Nations entities operating in Yemen. It requests the Secretary-General to deploy UNMHA expeditiously, report monthly on progress, and present a review of UNMHA by five months from the adoption of this resolution.

The Council calls on parties to support the United Nations, ensure the safety and security of UNMHA personnel, and facilitate their movement. It requests Member States to support the United Nations as required. The Council decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
